messages.title: It's Friday 7 May and a narrow election win has made David Cameron Prime Minister
messages.content: So straight away he gets to work on his Tory plans for Britain...

messages.title: AND YET FOR THE LUCKY FEW...
messages.content: He gives a £200,000 tax giveaway to each of the 3,000 richest estates in Britain.

messages.title: But it isn't Friday 7 May
messages.content: The Tories haven't changed. David Cameron and the Tory policies deliver for the privileged few, not the many.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: CHILD TRUST FUND AND CHILD TAX CREDITS CUT
keyPolicies.policyDescription: He cuts Child Trust Funds and Child Tax Credits for millions of hardworking families.
His plans to take billions of pounds out of the economy means immediate cuts to your schools and police.
He scraps a fund which supports 200,000 jobs.
He scraps your right to see a cancer specialist within two weeks if you or your suspects you have cancer.
His plans for immediate cuts mean thousands of jobs go.
He gives every standard taxpayer a £1,800 bill, just to pay for his election giveaways.

issues.economy: His plans to take billions of pounds out of the economy means immediate cuts to your schools and police.
issues.education: His plans to take billions of pounds out of the economy means immediate cuts to your schools and police.
issues.health: He scraps your right to see a cancer specialist within two weeks if you or your suspects you have cancer.

housing.content: He gives a £200,000 tax giveaway to each of the 3,000 richest estates in Britain.
